source_sentence: 佛說頂生王因緣經卷第三
translation: Foshuo jingdingshengwang yianyin jing, vol. 3

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿傳
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝奉大夫試光祿卿傳

source_sentence: 法大師賜紫沙門臣施護等奉　詔譯
translation: The Master of the Dharma bestowed upon the purple-robed ministers Shihu and others an imperial edict that they should translate it.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 其上即是三十三天所居之處，彼有龍王住於水際，所謂難陀龍王、烏波難陀龍王、阿說多哩龍王、母唧隣那龍王、摩那斯龍王、伊羅鉢怛羅龍王等，
translation: Above this is the place where the gods of the thirty-threefold heaven live. There was a dragon king there living on the edge of the water called Nanda, Upananda, Aśvajit, Maudgalyāyana, Manas, Elāpattra, and so on.

source_sentence: 住壽經劫，護持世間，力無能敵。
translation: He lived for a long eon, protecting the world with powers that were unmatched.

source_sentence: 是諸龍王與堅首天、持鬘天、常驕天、四大王天，同為守護三十三天。
translation: These dragon kings and the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the eternally arrogant gods, and the four great heavenly kings all guarded the thirty-three gods together.

source_sentence: 若阿修羅來鬪戰時，即各對敵及為震警。
translation: When an asura comes to fight, he's facing an enemy or being alarmed.

source_sentence: 「爾時，頂生王將復前進，為諸龍王遮止導翼兵眾。
translation: At the time, King Mandhātu was about to advance again, and he shielded himself from the dragon kings and guided his troops of soldiers.

source_sentence: 王乃問言：『何不進邪？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why don't you advance?'

source_sentence: 時主兵神答言：『天子！
translation: The lord of the army replied, 'Dear gods!

source_sentence: 此是龍王遮止兵眾。』
translation: This is the dragon king who stops the army of soldiers.'

source_sentence: 王言：『而龍王者，傍生之類，非我所敵，今悉驅令為我導翼。』
translation: The king said, 'That's because the dragon king is a type of unenlightened creature who isn't our opponent and now drives them all away to be my guide.'

source_sentence: 言已，諸龍即導王前至堅首天王所。
translation: After they said so, the dragons went in front of the king and led him to the place where King Stable Chief was staying.

source_sentence: 彼天王問言：『汝等何故奔馳來此？』
translation: The king of gods asked, 'Why are you running here?'

source_sentence: 諸龍答言：『人間有王，名曰頂生，彼將至此，故我導前。』
translation: The dragons replied, 'There's a king among humans named topknot who's about to come here, so I'll guide him forward.'

source_sentence: 時堅首天王即復遮止不令前進。
translation: The king of the Trāyastriṃśa gods then again obstructed him and didn't allow him to advance.

source_sentence: 王乃問言：『何不進邪？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why don't you advance?'

source_sentence: 主兵神答言：『天子！
translation: The lord of the army replied, 'Dear gods!

source_sentence: 此有堅首天王遮止兵眾。』
translation: Here, there's the king of the firm-headed celestial king who hides his troops.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此堅首天亦使為我導翼之者。』
translation: The king said, 'This firm-headed celestial being will also cause me to guide his wing.'

source_sentence: 言已，彼天即導王前至持鬘天王所。
translation: After he said so, that god then went in front of the king and led him to the palace of the Śakra Devānām-Indra heavenly king.

source_sentence: 彼天王問言：『汝今何故奔馳來此？』
translation: The king of gods asked, 'Why are you running here now?'

source_sentence: 天王答言：『人間有王，名曰頂生，彼將至此，故我導前。』
translation: The king of gods answered, 'There's a king among humans named Zhengsheng, and he's about to come here; therefore, I'll guide him.'

source_sentence: 時持鬘天王即復遮止不令前進。
translation: The king of the Śakra Devānām-Indra then again obstructed him and didn't allow him to advance.

source_sentence: 王乃問言：『何不進邪？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why don't you advance?'

source_sentence: 主兵神答言：『天子！
translation: The lord of the army replied, 'Dear gods!

source_sentence: 此有持鬘天王遮止兵眾。』
translation: Here, there's the god Śakra Devānām-Indra who hides and stops the army.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此持鬘天亦使為我導翼之者。』
translation: The king said, 'This is the bearer of the sandalwood heaven who will also be my guide and wing.'

source_sentence: 言已，彼天即導王前至常驕天王所。
translation: After he said this, the gods then led the king to the place where King Sadāparibhūta was staying.

source_sentence: 彼天王問言：『汝今何故奔馳來此？』
translation: The king of gods asked, 'Why are you running here now?'

source_sentence: 天王答言：『人間有王，名曰頂生，彼將至此，故我導前。』
translation: The king of gods answered, 'There's a king among humans named Zhengsheng, and he's about to come here; therefore, I'll guide him.'

source_sentence: 時常驕天王即復遮止不令前進。
translation: The king of the eternally arrogant celestial kings then again stopped them and didn't allow them to advance.

source_sentence: 王乃問言：『何不進邪？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why don't you advance?'

source_sentence: 主兵神答言：『天子！
translation: The lord of the army replied, 'Dear gods!

source_sentence: 此有常驕天王遮止兵眾。』
translation: This is the eternally arrogant celestial king who hides and stops his troops.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此常驕天亦使為我導翼之者。』
translation: The king said, 'This is the eternally arrogant god who causes me to guide his wing.'

source_sentence: 言已，彼天即導王前至四大天王所。
translation: After he said so, the gods then led the king to the four great celestial kings in front of him.

source_sentence: 彼天王問言：『汝今何故奔馳來此？』
translation: The king of gods asked, 'Why are you running here now?'

source_sentence: 天王答言：『人間有王，名曰頂生，彼將至此，故我導前。』
translation: The king of gods answered, 'There's a king among humans named Zhengsheng, and he's about to come here; therefore, I'll guide him.'

source_sentence: 「爾時四大天王互相議曰：『此人間王，具大福德，有大名稱，我等豈能與相違背。』
translation: It was then that the four great celestial kings discussed among themselves, saying, 'This human king is endowed with great merit and great reputation, so how could we disagree with him?'

source_sentence: 言已，俱詣帝釋天主所，具陳上事。
translation: After they said so, they all went to the lord of Indra and explained the above matters in detail.

source_sentence: 時帝釋天主言：『此大福德，有大名稱，我亦不應與相違背。』
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra then said, 'This great merit has a great reputation, so I shouldn't disagree with it.'

source_sentence: 言已，即持妙閼伽瓶，前起承迎。
translation: After he said so, he took the marvelous vial and rose in front to greet him.

source_sentence: 「爾時，頂生王遙見須彌山上樹林蓊欝，其密如雲，聳直紺青，色狀殊麗；
translation: At that time King Mandhātu saw from a distance the tree in the forest on the top of Mount Sumeru, which was as dense as a cloud rising high and straight, dark blue in color and shape with exquisite beauty.

source_sentence: 乃問導翼夜叉神禰舞迦言：『前有樹林斯名何等？』
translation: He asked Daoyi, the yakṣa spirit Kauśinagara, 'There's a forest in front of you, what's its name?'

source_sentence: 禰舞迦答言：『天子！
translation: Kauṣṭhila replied, 'Dear gods!

source_sentence: 此是三十三天中，波利質多羅樹及俱毘陀羅樹等，彼諸天眾夏四月中，
translation: These are the pārijātaka trees and kumbhīra trees of the thirty-three gods.

source_sentence: 於其樹下五欲娛樂嬉戲自在。
translation: Under that tree, he indulges in the five desires and plays freely.

source_sentence: 天子！
translation: Son of God!

source_sentence: 今時往彼亦受斯樂。』
translation: Now, I'll go there and experience this happiness as well.'

source_sentence: 時王聞已，謂諸臣佐言：『汝等前見樹林如雲紺青不？』
translation: After the king heard this, he said to his ministers and assistants, 'Did you see the forest like a cloud of purple blue in front of you?'

source_sentence: 臣佐答言：『唯然已見。』
translation: The minister replied, 'Yes, I've seen it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此是三十三天中，波利質多羅樹及俱毘陀羅樹等，彼諸天眾夏四月中，
translation: The king said, 'These are the pārijātaka trees and kumbhīra trees of the thirty-three gods.

source_sentence: 於其樹下五欲娛樂嬉戲自在；
translation: At the foot of that tree they indulge in the five senses and play freely.

source_sentence: 汝等往彼亦受斯樂。』
translation: You go there and you'll also experience this happiness.'

source_sentence: 「時頂生王又復前進，見須彌山上白雲高起聚若山峯，復問禰舞迦言：『前有白雲聚若高峯，
translation: Again, King Mandhātu advanced further and saw that the white clouds rose high above Mount Sumeru as high as a mountain peak.

source_sentence: 斯名何等？』
translation: What's the name of this?'

source_sentence: 禰舞迦答言：『天子！
translation: Kauṣṭhila replied, 'Dear gods!

source_sentence: 此是三十三天中善法之堂，彼天子眾與四大天王常共集會，思惟觀察稱量世間，
translation: “This is the hall of true teaching in the thirty-three-fold heaven. The celestial beings and the four great guardian gods always assemble together to meditate, contemplate, and evaluate the world.

source_sentence: 若天若人諸所有事。
translation: All the things that are possessed by gods and humans.

source_sentence: 天子！
translation: Son of God!

source_sentence: 今時宜應往彼。』
translation: It's appropriate to go there now.'

source_sentence: 其王聞已，謂諸臣佐言：『汝等前見白雲高起聚若山峯不？』
translation: After hearing this, the king said to his ministers and assistants, 'Did you see white clouds rising high up like mountain peaks in front of you?'

source_sentence: 臣佐答言：『唯然已見。』
translation: The minister replied, 'Yes, I've seen it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此是三十三天中善法之堂，彼天子眾與四大天王常共集會，思惟觀察稱量世間，
translation: The king said, ‘This is the hall of the fine dharma in the thirty-three heavens. These celestial beings and the four great celestial kings always assemble together to meditate and contemplate on measuring the world.

source_sentence: 若天若人諸所有事；
translation: All the things that belong to gods and humans.

source_sentence: 汝等今時宜應往彼。』
translation: It's appropriate for you to go there now.'

source_sentence: 「復次，須彌山上三十三天中有善見城，其城縱廣正等二千五百由旬，
translation: “Furthermore, on the thirty-three sides of Mount Sumeru is the city of Sudarśana, which is exactly two thousand five hundred yojanas long and wide.

source_sentence: 周匝十千由旬，有七重城，彼一一城高一由旬半，純金所成。
translation: It is ten thousand yojanas in circumference and has seven walls one by one. Each of these walls, one yojana and a half in height, are made of pure gold.

source_sentence: 金城之上一一復有四種女牆，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；
translation: Above each of the golden walls were four kinds of women’s walls, made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal.

source_sentence: 復有重牆通往來道亦四寶成。
translation: Again, there's a heavy wall that penetrates past and future paths and also made of the four treasures.

source_sentence: 彼城中地有百一種采繪嚴飾，又復柔軟如兜羅緜及如妙[疊*毛]，下足隨陷舉足隨起。
translation: The ground in the city was decorated with a hundred kinds of exquisitely painted patterns, as soft and supple as cotton cloth or fine cotton cloth, falling down one foot and rising up another.

source_sentence: 有天曼陀羅華散布其地深可膝量，香風時來吹去萎華更雨新者。
translation: A heavenly maṇḍala flower spreads over the ground as deep as kneels, and a fragrant breeze blows away the withered flowers and rains down new ones.

source_sentence: 彼善見城有一千一門，其一一門長二由旬半，闊半由旬，皆以牛頭旃檀香木所成；
translation: The city of Sudarśana had one thousand and one gates. Each gate was two yojanas in length and half a yojana long and half a yojana wide, all made of sandalwood from oxhead sandalwood.

source_sentence: 彼一一門，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦寶間錯莊嚴，狀如星象及半月相。
translation: Each of those gates is decorated with a mixture of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal treasures, shaped like stars, elephants, and crescents.

source_sentence: 又一一門各有五百青衣夜叉，身被甲冑而作守衛；
translation: Each of these gates was also guarded by five hundred night-vision yakṣas in blue robes, armored with their bodies.

source_sentence: 又能護持三十三天諸天子眾作諸善利。
translation: They can also protect the Trāyastriṃśa gods and create good benefits for them.

source_sentence: 城中街衢長二百五十由旬，闊十二由旬，種種莊嚴金沙布地，觸處遍灑旃檀香水，
translation: The streets within the city are two hundred and fifty yojanas in length and twelve yojanas in width. Various adornments of gold sand cover the ground, and sandalwood fragrance is sprinkled all over the place where one touches it.

source_sentence: 金繩交絡垂金鈴鐸以界道側。
translation: The golden cord interlocks and hangs with a golden bell and chime at the side of the road.

source_sentence: 「街衢左右復有種種清淨池沼，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等以布其底，池之四面有四梯陛，
translation: To the left and right of the streets there are also various pure ponds and marshes, covered with gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal. The four sides of the pond have four stairways leading up to each side.

source_sentence: 金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；
translation: It was made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal.

source_sentence: 彼池沼中有四寶臺，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等間錯莊嚴；
translation: In the pond there was a four-jeweled terrace, decorated with ornaments of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal.

source_sentence: 若金為臺即銀為柱及以梁棟，若銀為臺即金為柱及以梁棟，若瑠璃為臺即頗胝迦為柱及以梁棟，
translation: If a golden dais is made of gold, it means a silver pillar or beam; if a silver dais is made of silver, it means a gold pillar or beam; and if a lapis lazuli dais is made of lapis lazuli, it means a pillar or beam.

source_sentence: 若頗胝迦為臺即瑠璃為柱及以梁棟；
translation: Suppose a terrace is made of crystal, that is, the pillars and beams are made of lapis lazuli.

source_sentence: 清涼甘美水滿池中；
translation: The lake was filled with cool, sweet water.

source_sentence: 優鉢羅華、鉢訥摩華、俱母陀華、奔拏利迦華等，遍覆其內。
translation: It's covered with blue lotus blossoms, white lotus blossoms, pink lotus blossoms, red lotus blossoms, and white lotus blossoms.

source_sentence: 復有種種水鳥遊戲池中出妙音聲，謂高遠聲、悅意聲、美妙聲等。
translation: Also, there are various water birds playing in the pond that produce subtle sounds, which are distant sounds, pleasing sounds, beautiful sounds, and so forth.

source_sentence: 「復有種種華樹果樹，直生端立圓無缺減，如結鬘師取以妙線，妙巧安布盤結成鬘，
translation: “Furthermore, there are various kinds of flowers, trees, and fruit trees that grow straight up at the ends without any gap or diminution, like a knitter who takes a marvelous thread and skillfully spreads it on a board to form a bowl.

source_sentence: 華果樹林亦復如是。
translation: So it is with the flowers, fruits, and trees.

source_sentence: 彼樹復有種種飛鳥，遊止其上出妙音聲。
translation: That tree also had various flying birds that roamed above it, producing subtle sounds.

source_sentence: 又彼城中有青、黃、赤、白四色劫波衣樹，其樹所出四色妙衣；
translation: In that city there were trees with garments of the four colors, blue, yellow, red, and white, producing beautiful garments of the four colors.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等思其衣者，纔起心時而自至手。
translation: If those gods and goddesses think of their robes, they simply reach their own hands when they arouse their minds.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙音樂樹，所謂簫、笛、琴、箜篌等；
translation: There were also various kinds of trees producing exquisite music, such as lutes, flutes, lutes, stringed instruments, and harps.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等思音樂者，纔起心時其樂自鳴。
translation: If those gods and goddesses contemplate music, their music will sound on its own when they just arouse their minds.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙莊嚴樹，彼樹所出手釧足環，及身莊嚴妙好之具；
translation: There were also various kinds of exquisitely adorned trees from which to produce hand-clad feet and rings, as well as exquisitely beautiful ornaments such as body embellishments.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等思莊嚴具者，纔起心時而自至手。
translation: If those gods and goddesses think of adornments, they reach their own hands just as soon as they give rise to mind.

source_sentence: 又有四色蘇陀味食，謂青、黃、赤、白；
translation: Again, there is food of four colors: blue, yellow, red, and white.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等思其食者，纔起心時而自至手。
translation: If those gods and goddesses think of food, they reach their own hands when they just arouse their minds.

source_sentence: 又有四種所飲之漿，謂末度漿、摩達網漿、迦譚末梨漿、播曩漿等。
translation: Also, there are four kinds of juice that can be drunk, namely, the juice of mustard seed, the juice of māda net, the juice of kaṭāmarī, and the juice of sow.

source_sentence: 復有種種殊妙莊嚴殿堂樓閣，諸天女眾或處其中安隱而坐，或觀視遊行，
translation: There were also various kinds of exquisitely adorned palaces and towers, in which the celestial maidens might sit peacefully or watch and wander.

source_sentence: 悉有種種輿輦服用莊嚴之具，天女駢隘擊鼓奏歌，爇眾名香豐諸飲食。
translation: They all had various kinds of carriages, carrying adornments, celestial maidens played drums and songs in small groups, and they offered food and drink to the multitude with names and fragrances.

source_sentence: 而彼天眾與諸眷屬嬉戲娛樂，隨自福力受斯勝果。
translation: The gods and their retinues played and amuse themselves, and they received this excellent result according to their own merit.

source_sentence: 「復次，善見城東二十由旬，有園名寶車，縱廣正等二百五十由旬，周匝千由旬，
translation: “Twenty yojanas to the east of Sudarśana is a park called Jewel Carriage, two hundred and fifty yojanas long and one thousand yojanas in circumference.

source_sentence: 內外嚴麗殊妙可觀。
translation: Both inside and outside it are beautiful and marvelous to look at.

source_sentence: 園有金牆高半由旬；
translation: In the park there is a golden wall one-half yojana high.

source_sentence: 金牆之上有四女牆，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；
translation: Above the golden wall there were four women’s walls, made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal.

source_sentence: 復有重牆通往來道亦四寶作。
translation: Again, there's a heavy wall that penetrates past and future paths and is also made of the four treasures.

source_sentence: 其園中地有百一種采繪嚴飾；
translation: The ground in the garden was decorated with a hundred kinds of exquisitely painted patterns.

source_sentence: 又復柔軟如兜羅緜及如妙[疊*毛]，下足隨陷舉足隨起。
translation: It's also as soft as a tula and as wonderful [tuft of *hair], with lower legs falling down and raising up.

source_sentence: 有天曼陀羅華散布其地，深可膝量，香風時來吹去萎華更雨新者。
translation: The ground was covered with heavenly maṇḍala flowers that were as deep as the depth of a knee, and fragrant breezes blew away the withered flowers and rained down new ones.

source_sentence: 寶車園中有大池沼，縱廣正等五十由旬，周匝二百由旬，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等以布其底；
translation: In the park of the jeweled carts was a large pond, exactly fifty yojanas long and wide, two hundred yojanas in all directions, covered with gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, and other precious substances.

source_sentence: 池之四面有四梯陛，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；
translation: On each of the four sides of the pond there were four staircases, made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal.

source_sentence: 彼池沼中有四寶臺，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等間錯莊嚴；
translation: In the pond there was a four-jeweled terrace, decorated with ornaments of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal.

source_sentence: 若金為臺即銀為柱及以梁棟，若銀為臺即金為柱及以梁棟，若瑠璃為臺即頗胝迦為柱及以梁棟，
translation: If a golden dais is made of gold, it means a silver pillar or beam; if a silver dais is made of silver, it means a gold pillar or beam; and if a lapis lazuli dais is made of lapis lazuli, it means a pillar or beam.

source_sentence: 若頗胝迦為臺即瑠璃為柱及以梁棟；
translation: Suppose a terrace is made of crystal, that is, the pillars and beams are made of lapis lazuli.

source_sentence: 清涼甘美水滿池中；
translation: The lake was filled with cool, sweet water.

source_sentence: 優鉢羅華、鉢訥摩華、俱母陀華、奔拏利迦華等，遍覆其內。
translation: It's covered with blue lotus blossoms, white lotus blossoms, pink lotus blossoms, red lotus blossoms, and white lotus blossoms.

source_sentence: 復有種種水鳥遊戲池中出妙音聲，謂高遠聲、悅意聲、美妙聲等。
translation: Also, there are various water birds playing in the pond that produce subtle sounds, which are distant sounds, pleasing sounds, beautiful sounds, and so forth.

source_sentence: 復有種種華樹果樹，直生端立圓無缺減，如結鬘師取以妙線妙，巧安布盤結成鬘，
translation: There are also various kinds of flowers, trees, and fruit-bearing trees that grow straight up to their ends without any gap or diminution, like the skillfully arranged trays formed into bowls made of exquisitely woven thread.

source_sentence: 華果樹林亦復如是。
translation: So it is with the flowers, fruits, and trees.

source_sentence: 彼樹復有種種飛鳥，遊止其上出妙音聲。
translation: That tree also had various flying birds that roamed above it, producing subtle sounds.

source_sentence: 觸處皆有青、黃、赤、白四色劫波衣樹，其樹所出四色妙衣。
translation: Where he touches it, there are trees of blue, yellow, red, and white four-colored cotton garments, and the four-colored marvelous garments that emerge from those trees.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙音樂樹，所謂簫、笛、琴、箜篌等。
translation: There are also various kinds of wonderful music trees, called chews, flutes, lusters, lutes, and harps.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙莊嚴樹，彼樹所出手釧足環，及身莊嚴妙好之具。
translation: There are also various kinds of wonderfully adorned trees, from which they produce hand-clad feet and rings as well as exquisitely beautiful ornaments that adorn their bodies.

source_sentence: 又有四色蘇陀味食，謂青、黃、赤、白。
translation: Again, there are four kinds of food with the taste of srota: blue, yellow, red, and white.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等隨所思者，纔起心時而皆自至。
translation: If those gods and goddesses follow what they think, they'll reach it on their own when they give rise to the mind.

source_sentence: 又有四種所飲之漿，謂末度漿、摩達網漿、迦譚末梨漿、播曩漿等。
translation: Also, there are four kinds of juice that can be drunk, namely, the juice of mustard seed, the juice of māda net, the juice of kaṭāmarī, and the juice of sow.

source_sentence: 復有種種殊妙莊嚴殿堂樓閣，諸天女眾或處其中安隱而坐，或觀視遊行，
translation: There were also various kinds of exquisitely adorned palaces and towers, in which the celestial maidens might sit peacefully or watch and wander.

source_sentence: 悉有種種輿輦服用莊嚴之具。
translation: They all had various kinds of carriages and robes to carry the adornments.

source_sentence: 天女駢隘擊鼓奏歌，爇眾名香，豐諸飲食。
translation: The heavenly maidens played drums and sang songs in small groups. They devoured the renowned fragrances of the assembly and provided plenty of food and drink.

source_sentence: 而彼天眾與諸眷屬嬉戲娛樂，隨自福力受斯勝果。
translation: The gods and their retinues played and amuse themselves, and they received this excellent result according to their own merit.

source_sentence: 「園中道路長二十由旬，闊半由旬，清淨嚴飾金沙布地；
translation: The path in the park is twenty yojanas long and half a yojanas wide, adorned with pure gold sand that spreads on the ground.

source_sentence: 觸處遍灑旃檀香水；
translation: Everywhere he touched, he sprinkled sandalwood perfume.

source_sentence: 金繩交絡垂金鈴鐸；
translation: The golden cords interlock and hang the golden bells and chimes.

source_sentence: 道路左右亦有種種華果樹林，飛鳥遊戲出妙音聲；
translation: To the left and right of the road there are also various kinds of flowering fruit trees, with flying birds playing and producing sublime sounds.

source_sentence: 亦有四色劫波衣樹及音樂樹莊嚴樹等；
translation: Also there were trees of garments made of four colors, such as the cotton cloth and music trees.

source_sentence: 復有四種莊嚴輿輦，謂象乘、馬乘、車乘、寶輿；
translation: “Furthermore, there are four kinds of adorned carriages: elephant carts, horse carts, chariots, and precious carriages.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等思其乘馭往遊戲者，纔起心時隨思即至，乘已遊行受諸快樂。
translation: If those gods and goddesses think about their vehicles, chariots, and play, they'll follow them when they just arouse their minds and arrive, and after riding them, they'll travel and experience the pleasures.

source_sentence: 「此園何故名為寶車？
translation: Why is this park called the Jeweled Carriage?

source_sentence: 謂此園中所有池沼、華果、樹林、衣服、嚴具及天女等，皆以眾寶所莊嚴故；
translation: All the ponds, flowers, fruits, trees, clothing, ornaments, and celestial maidens in this park are all adorned with myriad jewels.

source_sentence: 又有寶車諸天子眾乘馭遊戲，以是緣故名寶車園。
translation: There are also jeweled chariots and other celestial beings riding in these chariots. For this reason it is called the Jeweled Carriage Park.

source_sentence: 「復次，寶車園東二十由旬，有寶嚴地，縱廣正等二百五十由旬，周匝千由旬；
translation: “Furthermore, twenty yojanas to the east of the Jeweled Carriage Park is another jeweled site, two hundred fifty yojanas long and one thousand yojanas in circumference.

source_sentence: 有百一種采繪嚴飾清淨柔軟；
translation: There were one hundred kinds of exquisitely decorated, pure and supple patterns.

source_sentence: 其地中間有四寶臺間錯莊嚴；
translation: Between the two sides of the ground there are four-jeweled terraces decorated in various ways.

source_sentence: 天曼陀羅華散布其地；
translation: The ground was covered with celestial maṇḍala flowers.

source_sentence: 道路長二十由旬，闊半由旬清淨嚴飾；
translation: The road was twenty yojanas long and half a yojana wide, pure and beautifully decorated.

source_sentence: 華果、樹林、衣服、音樂、莊嚴等樹一一具足；
translation: Flowers, fruits, forests, clothing, music, ornaments, and other trees were all present.

source_sentence: 亦有輿輦隨思即至受諸快樂。
translation: There's also a carriage that follows thoughts and immediately receives the pleasures.

source_sentence: 彼有天仙修習梵行。
translation: There are gods and sages there who cultivate the religious practice.

source_sentence: 「復次，善見城南二十由旬，有園名麤堅，縱廣正等二百五十由旬，周匝千由旬，
translation: Again, twenty yojanas to the south of the city of Sudarśana is a park called Sadāparvata, two hundred fifty yojanas long and one thousand yojanas in circumference.

source_sentence: 內外嚴麗殊妙可觀；
translation: The inner and outer walls are beautiful and marvelous to be seen.

source_sentence: 園有金牆高一由旬；
translation: In the park there is a golden wall one yojana high.

source_sentence: 金牆之上有四女牆，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；
translation: Above the golden wall there were four women’s walls, made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal.

source_sentence: 復有重牆通往來道亦四寶作。
translation: Again, there's a heavy wall that penetrates past and future paths and is also made of the four treasures.

source_sentence: 其園中地有百一種采繪嚴飾；
translation: The ground in the garden was decorated with a hundred kinds of exquisitely painted patterns.

source_sentence: 又復柔軟如兜羅緜及如妙[疊*毛]，下足隨陷舉足隨起。
translation: It's also as soft as a tula and as wonderful [tuft of *hair], with lower legs falling down and raising up.

source_sentence: 有天曼陀羅華散布其地深可膝量，香風時來吹去萎華更雨新者。
translation: A heavenly maṇḍala flower spreads over the ground as deep as kneels, and a fragrant breeze blows away the withered flowers and rains down new ones.

source_sentence: 「麤堅園中有大池沼，縱廣正等五十由旬，周匝二百由旬，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等以布其底；
translation: “In the forest-dwelling grove there is a large pond, fifty yojanas in width and two hundred yojanas in circumference, covered with gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, and so on.

source_sentence: 池之四面有四梯陛，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；
translation: On each of the four sides of the pond there were four staircases, made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and crystal.

source_sentence: 彼池沼中有四寶臺，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等間錯莊嚴，若金為臺即銀為柱及以梁棟，
translation: In the pond there was a four-jeweled terrace adorned with ornaments of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, and so forth.

source_sentence: 若銀為臺即金為柱及以梁棟，若瑠璃為臺即頗胝迦為柱及以梁棟，若頗胝迦為臺即瑠璃為柱及以梁棟；
translation: If the platform is made of silver, that is to say, with a pillar of gold and a supporting beam; if the platform is made of lapis lazuli, that is to say, with a pillar of crystal or a supporting beam; if the span is made of lapis lazuli, that is to say, with a pillar of lapis lazuli or a supporting

source_sentence: 清涼甘美水滿池中；
translation: The lake was filled with cool, sweet water.

source_sentence: 優鉢羅華、鉢訥摩華、俱母陀華、奔拏利迦華等，遍覆其內；
translation: It was covered with blue lotus blossoms, pink lotus blossoms, white lotus blossoms, red lotus blossoms, and white lotus blossoms.

source_sentence: 復有種種水鳥遊戲池中，出妙音聲，謂高遠聲、悅意聲、美妙聲等。
translation: Also, there are various water birds playing in the pond that produce subtle sounds, which are distant sounds, pleasing sounds, beautiful sounds, and so forth.

source_sentence: 「復有種種華樹果樹，直生端立圓無缺減，如結鬘師取以妙線，妙巧安布盤結成鬘，
translation: “Furthermore, there are various kinds of flowers, trees, and fruit trees that grow straight up at the ends without any gap or diminution, like a knitter who takes a marvelous thread and skillfully spreads it on a board to form a bowl.

source_sentence: 華果樹林亦復如是。
translation: So it is with the flowers, fruits, and trees.

source_sentence: 彼樹復有種種飛鳥，遊止其上出妙音聲。
translation: That tree also had various flying birds that roamed above it, producing subtle sounds.

source_sentence: 觸處皆有青、黃、赤、白四色劫波衣樹，其樹所出四色妙衣；
translation: Wherever he touched, there were trees of blue, yellow, red, white, and four colored cotton cloth. The trees produced the exquisite cloth of four colors.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙音樂樹，所謂簫、笛、琴、箜篌等；
translation: There were also various kinds of trees producing exquisite music, such as lutes, flutes, lutes, stringed instruments, and harps.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙莊嚴樹，彼樹所出手釧足環，及身莊嚴妙好之具；
translation: There were also various kinds of exquisitely adorned trees from which to produce hand-clad feet and rings, as well as exquisitely beautiful ornaments such as body embellishments.

source_sentence: 又有四色蘇陀味食，謂青、黃、赤、白。
translation: Again, there are four kinds of food with the taste of srota: blue, yellow, red, and white.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等隨所思者，纔起心時而皆自至。
translation: If those gods and goddesses follow what they think, they'll reach it on their own when they give rise to the mind.

source_sentence: 又有四種所飲之漿，謂末度漿、摩達網漿、迦譚末梨漿、播曩漿等。
translation: Also, there are four kinds of juice that can be drunk, namely, the juice of mustard seed, the juice of māda net, the juice of kaṭāmarī, and the juice of sow.

source_sentence: 復有種種殊妙莊嚴殿堂樓閣，諸天女等或處其中安隱而坐、或觀視遊行，
translation: There were also various kinds of exquisitely adorned palaces and towers, in which the celestial maidens might sit peacefully or watch and wander.

source_sentence: 悉有種種輿輦服用莊嚴之具，天女駢隘擊鼓奏歌，爇眾名香豐諸飲食。
translation: They all had various kinds of carriages, carrying adornments, celestial maidens played drums and songs in small groups, and they offered food and drink to the multitude with names and fragrances.

source_sentence: 而彼天眾與諸眷屬嬉戲娛樂，隨自福力受斯勝果。
translation: The gods and their retinues played and amuse themselves, and they received this excellent result according to their own merit.

translation: The path in the park is twenty yojanas long and half a yojanas wide, adorned with pure gold sand that spreads on the ground.

source_sentence: 觸處遍灑旃檀香水，金繩交絡垂金鈴鐸。
translation: Everywhere he touches, he sprinkles sandalwood perfume with golden cords interlocked and draped with golden bells and chimes.

source_sentence: 道路左右亦有種種華果樹林，飛鳥遊戲出妙音聲；
translation: To the left and right of the road there are also various kinds of flowering fruit trees, with flying birds playing and producing sublime sounds.

source_sentence: 亦有四色劫波衣樹及音樂樹莊嚴樹等；
translation: Also there were trees of garments made of four colors, such as the cotton cloth and music trees.

source_sentence: 復有四種莊嚴輿輦，謂象乘、馬乘、車乘、寶輿；
translation: “Furthermore, there are four kinds of adorned carriages: elephant carts, horse carts, chariots, and precious carriages.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等思其乘馭往遊戲者，纔起心時隨思即至，乘已遊行受諸快樂。
translation: If those gods and goddesses think about their vehicles, chariots, and play, they'll follow them when they just arouse their minds and arrive, and after riding them, they'll travel and experience the pleasures.

source_sentence: 「此園何故名為麤堅？
translation: Why is this park called Vaiśravaṇa?

source_sentence: 謂此園中所有池沼、華果、樹林、衣服、嚴具及天女等悉麤堅故；
translation: It means that all the ponds, flowers, fruits, trees, clothing, ornaments, and celestial maidens in this park are coarse and hard.

source_sentence: 又此園中諸天子眾，若身若心皆悉麤猛而好鬪戰，由是緣故名麤堅園。
translation: Also, the celestial beings in this park are all fierce and skilled in fighting with their bodies and minds, and for this reason it's called the Firmness Treasury.

translation: Foshuo jingdingshengwang yianyin jing, vol. 3
